projectGridLines.title: A blueprint for sustainable, equitable, and planned Urbanisation in India
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

India’s cities are burgeoning. Our cities are expected to host over 800 million citizens by 2050, over half of India’s population. India’s growth story is playing out in our cities, contributing about two-thirds of India’s GDP, and about 70 percent of future employment. There is a clear need to study existing data on spatial contiguity, urban sprawl, migration, jobs, and livelihoods, environment (both built and natural), health (mapping causes and effects of unplanned cities to health outcomes), and synthesise insights to facilitate the creation of a blueprint for sustainable, equitable, and planned urbanisation. 


The study aims to study the effect of the natural growth of population in Indian cities and migration happening between rural and urban regions over time. In addition, it will look at various economic and ecological drivers that impact population health outcomes. The analysis will feed into a blueprint for sustainable, equitable, and planned urbanisation that could be replicated in other geographies.



Skill sets:

  • Well-versed with data cleaning, sorting, and reporting tools like Excel, Tableau, SQL, etc
  • Advanced statistical analysis
  • Data visualization
  • Proficiency with R, Python, or any other statistical programming languages
  • Applying GIS tools and working with a variety of climate, health, and socioeconomic datasets
  • Research acumen
  • Writing and communication skills


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills

Expected learning:

  • Immersive opportunity to apply data science to real-world problem statements in the field of climate change and health
  • A rigorous policy research experience in sustainable urban planning


Specific courses required for project execution:  

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course
